intro: Lasiocephalus hypoleucus, commonly known as the white-headed ant plant, is a unique member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive white, woolly inflorescence that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated by plant enthusiasts.
